page.title: 02Great Cornard.Pop.7684
page.content: We have surveyed just a small area of this village. Within it are three schools-a first school, a middle school,and an upper school, all standing on the same campus. There is part of a private housing estate bordering the grounds of the first and upper schools and there is also a Rugby Club. The population of this village expanded greatly during the mid nineteen sixties as it was developed as a London overspill area with the promise of employment at the nearby C.A.V. factory making diesel engines and fuel injection systems.There are eleven shops,four public houses,a church,a church hall, and a village hall.There is a youth unemployment scheme in the village and many clubs thrive.
